intro: Thesium macedonicum, commonly known as the Macedonian thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to the Balkan region, particularly found in parts of North Macedonia and Greece. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Thesium macedonicum is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
